dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2891 IH: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the eligibility of children of Vietnam veterans born with spina bifida for benefits of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bishop of Georgia (for himself and Mr. Dent) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the eligibility of children of Vietnam veterans born with spina bifida for benefits of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.header: Clarification of eligibility for spina bifida-related benefits of the Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Section 1832 of title 38, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking The provisions and inserting Except as provided by subsection (c), the provisions; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Exception for benefits for spina bifida
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the effective date for an award of benefits under subchapter I of this chapter for a child of a Vietnam veteran who is suffering from spina bifida is the date on which the child is born.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall be effective as if included in the enactment of chapter 18 of such title 38.
